page.title: 03St Andrew Church,Laverstock.
page.content: {The present church was built in 1858 on the site of a much earlier church, which dated back prior to the building of the cathedral of New Sarum.All that is left of the original building, is the ivy covered buttress in the south west part of the churchyard. When it was constructed for about Â£2500, the designer T.H. Wyatt was keen to use as much of this original building as possible which had some architectural merit.{The Norman Arch porch entrance {is original.}The well known Norman 'zig zag' pattern on arches is to be clearly seen. Two of the windows in the West and South West have pieces of {genuine 13c grisaille glass}which it is believed to have come{from the {Cathedral of New Sarum.}The church is well supported today as it was over the centuries past back through to the Reformation and before that.
